name: Alexander, Lamar
title: U.S. Senator (R-TN, 2003-2021); former President, University of Tennessee (1988-1991)
notes: Andrew Lamar Alexander Jr. (born July 3, 1940) served three terms as U.S. Senator from Tennessee (2003-2021), was Governor of Tennessee (1979-1987), and served as U.S. Secretary of Education under President George H.W. Bush (1991-1993). He also co-founded Blackberry Farm, Inc. and Corporate Child Care, Inc.
political_donations: Republican. Former U.S. Senator (R-TN, 2003-2021). Career fundraising and PAC activity tracked via Leadership PAC 'Tenn PAC.' Voted with Republican Party 86.4% of the time.

name: Alpert, Bernard S.
title: Plastic Surgeon
notes: Dr. Bernard S. Alpert is a plastic surgeon based in San Francisco, CA, with a practice at 45 Castro St, Suite 150. He graduated from University at Buffalo Jacobs School of Medicine in 1974 and has been practicing in the San Francisco Bay Area for over 35 years. He is affiliated with California Pacific Medical Center-Davies Campus.

name: Beck, Henry C. III
title: Executive Chairman
notes: Henry C. 'Peter' Beck III (born 1955) served as CEO of The Beck Group, a Dallas-based architecture, engineering, and construction firm, for 20 years before becoming Executive Chairman. He attended Phillips Andover, graduated from Princeton University with a civil engineering degree (1977), and received an MBA from Stanford Business School. He joined the company in 1977 and became CEO in 1992.

name: Boskin, Michael J.
title: T.M. Friedman Professor of Economics; Senior Fellow, Hoover Institution
notes: Michael Jay Boskin (born September 23, 1945) is an economist and senior fellow at the Hoover Institution. He served as Chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers under George H.W. Bush (1989-1993) and has been a director of ExxonMobil since 1996. He also serves on the boards of Oracle Corporation, Koret Foundation, and Bloom Energy.
political_donations: Republican donor. Donated to Romney for President ($1,000), Romney Victory Inc ($2,500), Boehner for Speaker ($1,000) in 2012 cycle. Previously served on Ronald Reagan's Tax Policy Task Force.

name: Brooks, Leon E. (Kix)
title: Country Music Artist; former Host, American Country Countdown (2006-2024)
notes: Leon Eric 'Kix' Brooks III (born May 12, 1955, Shreveport, LA) is best known as one half of the country duo Brooks & Dunn, which was active for 20 years. He hosted the syndicated radio show American Country Countdown from 2006 to 2024. Brooks & Dunn were inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 2019.
political_donations: Considers himself 'fairly conservative' and was a supporter of President George W. Bush. Specific FEC donation records not found publicly.

name: Buckley, Christopher
title: Novelist, Essayist, Humorist; former Editor-in-Chief, Forbes FYI/Forbes Life (1990-2007)
notes: Christopher Taylor Buckley (born September 28, 1952) is the son of William F. Buckley Jr. He graduated cum laude from Yale in 1976 and served as chief speechwriter for Vice President George H.W. Bush. He was editor-in-chief of Forbes FYI (later Forbes Life) from 1990 to 2007 and has authored over 20 books including 'Thank You for Smoking.'

name: Byers, Brook H.
title: Senior Partner (Advisor)
notes: Brook H. Byers (born August 2, 1945) joined Kleiner Perkins in 1977 and built its life sciences practice. He has been involved with more than 50 technology ventures and formed the first Life Sciences practice group in venture capital in 1984. He is a Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences (elected 2008).
ngos: NewSchools Venture Fund (board member); UCSF Medical Foundation (board member); California Healthcare Institute (board member); Environmental Defense Fund (member); Stanford Bio-X Advisory Council; TechNet (co-founder)
political_donations: Democratic donor. Donated $2,700 to Democratic Senate candidate Deborah Ross (2016). Large donor to Nancy Pelosi Victory Fund ($85,500), DSCC ($71,000), Pennsylvania Democratic Party ($10,000) in 2020 cycle; $484,850 total in 2020 cycle.

name: Cahill, John E. Jr.
title: Executive / Owner (son of founder John E. Cahill Sr.)
notes: John E. Cahill Jr. is the son of John E. Cahill Sr. (1916-2001), who built the Cahill Construction Co. of San Francisco into one of the city's most prominent construction firms. The elder Cahill was a Stanford engineering graduate and the company built iconic SF landmarks including St. Mary's Cathedral and the San Francisco Hilton. John Jr. was residing in Kentfield, CA as of 2001.

name: Chamberlain, David M.
title: Former Chairman and CEO, The Stride Rite Corporation
notes: David M. Chamberlain (born 1943, Fort Benning, GA) earned a BS from University of Pennsylvania (1965) and MBA from Harvard (1969). He served as CEO of Shaklee Corporation (1985-1993), CEO of Genesco Inc. (1994-1999), and Chairman/CEO of The Stride Rite Corporation (1999-2007) until its acquisition by Collective Brands.
ngos: San Francisco Boys and Girls Club (board); San Francisco Opera (board); San Francisco Chamber of Commerce (former president); California Roundtable (member)

name: Chapman, Duncan A.
title: Senior Advisor (formerly Partner)
notes: Duncan A. Chapman joined Lexington Partners in 2004 and was named Senior Advisor in 2022. Prior to Lexington he was president of Butler, Chapman & Co. (middle-market investment banking) and a senior vice president in investment banking at Lehman Brothers. He holds a BA in economics from Columbia University.

name: Conrad, Barnaby III
title: Author, Editor; Advisor and Investor at Inkshares.com
notes: Barnaby Conrad III (born 1952, San Francisco) is an American author, artist, and editor. He graduated from Yale University with a BA in Fine Arts (1975) and served as Editor-at-Large for Forbes Life. He has authored over 11 non-fiction books and hundreds of magazine articles. In 2009 he co-founded the Kanbar & Conrad Books imprint at Council Oak Books.

name: Dachs, Alan M.
title: Chair of the Board (retired CEO)
notes: Alan Mark Dachs (born December 7, 1947, New York City) earned a BA from Wesleyan University and an MBA from New York University. He has been President and CEO of the Fremont Group (the Bechtel family's private investment office) since 1989 and now serves as Chair. He is a Fellow of the American Academy of Arts & Sciences.
ngos: Brookings Institution (Senior Trustee); MIT Corporation (retired trustee); The Conference Board (Chair Emeritus of Board of Trustees); Wesleyan University (Chair Emeritus, Board of Trustees); American Academy of Arts and Sciences (former Vice Chair); S.D. Bechtel Jr. Foundation (retired board member)
political_donations: Donated $2,400 to Bennet for Colorado (Sen. Michael Bennet, D) in 2009. Primarily associated with Democratic and nonpartisan causes.

name: Draper, William H. III
employer: Draper Richards Kaplan Foundation / Sutter Hill Ventures
title: Co-Chair, Draper Richards Kaplan Foundation; Founder Emeritus, Sutter Hill Ventures
notes: William Henry Draper III (born January 1, 1928) is a venture capitalist who founded Sutter Hill Ventures in 1965 and co-founded Draper Richards Kaplan Foundation in 2002. He served as head of the United Nations Development Programme (1986-1993) and as President/Chairman of the Export-Import Bank (1981-1986). He attended Yale (1950) and Harvard Business School and is a member of Skull and Bones.
ngos: Draper Richards Kaplan Foundation (Co-Chair); America Abroad Media (Board of Advisors)
political_donations: Primarily Republican donor. Donated ~$56,000 in 2008 cycle including $28,750 to RNC, $10,000 to McCain Victory California, $4,600 to John McCain 2008; also donated $4,250 to Obama for America.

name: Ellis, Stephen A.
title: Managing Partner, The Rise Fund (impact investing platform at TPG)
notes: Stephen A. Ellis joined TPG in 2015 and co-leads The Rise Fund, a $2.1 billion global impact investing fund co-founded with Bono and Jeff Skoll in 2016. Prior to TPG, he was CEO of Asurion, LLC (2012-2015) and Worldwide Managing Director of Bain & Company (2005-2012). He graduated from UC Berkeley and Stanford Business School.
ngos: The Bridgespan Group (board); DreamBox Learning (board); Everfi (board); RFK Human Rights Center (board); Charles Schwab Corporation (director)

name: Fisher, William S.
title: Founder and CEO
notes: William S. Fisher (born 1958) is the son of Gap Inc. founders Donald and Doris Fisher. He earned a BA from Princeton and an MBA from Stanford, then worked at Gap expanding it internationally before founding London-based private equity firm Manzanita Capital in 2001, focused on branded luxury and consumer companies. He has been a Gap Inc. director since 2009.
ngos: Exploratorium (Vice Chair of the Board); San Francisco Playfields Initiative (Chair of the Board)
political_donations: Republican-leaning donor. The Fisher family (including William) donated nearly $9 million to 'Americans for Job Security,' a dark money group that opposed Barack Obama in 2012. In 2022, donated $980,000 to California's 'No on 30' campaign (opposing higher taxes on top earners).

name: Flores, James Clyde
title: Chairman, CEO and Founder
notes: James C. Flores has led five oil and gas E&P companies since 1982, including Plains Exploration & Production Company (NYSE: PXP) which was acquired by Freeport-McMoRan in 2013 for approximately $6.9 billion. He also served as Vice Chairman of Freeport-McMoRan. He founded Sable Offshore Corp. in 2021 to develop the Santa Ynez Unit offshore California. He graduated from Louisiana State University with degrees in corporate finance and petroleum land management.
political_donations: Republican donor. Contributed $1,356,607 in the 2016 cycle, including $250,000 to Trump Victory (July 2016), $100,000 to Love for Louisiana PAC, and $50,000 to Team Ryan (Paul Ryan's leadership PAC).

name: Hess, Justin
title: Vice President
notes: Justin Hess is Vice President at Vermilion Group, the private equity investment office of the Mortenson family (M.A. Mortenson Companies, Inc.). He previously worked as a Strategy & Operations consultant with Deloitte and as a Senior Analyst at a credit affiliate of Lone Star Funds. He holds an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

name: Howerton, David P.
title: Chairman
notes: David P. Howerton is Chairman of Hart Howerton, a global planning, architecture, and landscape architecture firm with offices in New York and San Francisco. He is renowned for his work across more than 50 countries over three decades, with notable projects including Santa Lucia Preserve (CA) and Palmetto Bluff (SC). He lectures at UVA, UC Berkeley, and Harvard.
ngos: Urban Land Institute Foundation (Governor); University of Virginia Architecture School Foundation (Trustee)

name: Jeffries, Bradford
employer: Venture Investment Management Company / Sigma Management (retired)
title: Co-Founder and Venture Capitalist (retired); formerly Partner, Cooley Godward LLP
notes: C. Bradford 'Brad' Jeffries (January 17, 1931 - June 30, 2023) was a venture capital attorney and investor. He joined Cooley, Crowley, Gaither, Godward, Castro & Huddleson in 1958 and helped build Silicon Valley's VC industry through participation in 28 venture capital funds and 150+ VC-backed companies. He retired from Cooley in 1984, co-founded Sigma Management, and in 1993 co-founded Venture Investment Management Company. He held a BA and JD from Stanford and was a vineyard proprietor in Napa.

name: Jeffries, Steven Bradford
title: Investment Adviser
notes: Steven Bradford Jeffries is a registered investment adviser listed in the SEC's Investment Adviser Public Disclosure (IAPD) system. He is associated with Jeffries Wealth Management. Likely the son of C. Bradford Jeffries, the Cooley Godward partner and venture capitalist.

name: Koranda, Kenneth
title: President, MidAmerica Bank (Chicago's largest thrift)
notes: Kenneth Koranda (approx. born 1950) served as President of MidAmerica Bank FSB, Chicago's largest savings institution, based in Hinsdale, Illinois. He and his brother Allen ran the bank together. When National City Corp. completed its $1.9 billion acquisition of MidAmerica's parent company MAF Bancorp in 2007, Kenneth held approximately 3.55% of shares and received $3.2 million in severance and benefits.

name: Livermore, Richard C.
title: Retired Superior Court Judge
notes: Richard C. Livermore earned a history degree from Stanford (1968) and a JD from Santa Clara University (1973). He practiced law as a sole practitioner, then served as Projects Director of RESOLVE (environmental dispute resolution) and founded Richard C. Livermore & Co. He was appointed to the San Mateo County Municipal Court by Governor Deukmejian in 1991, elevated to Superior Court in 1998, and retired from the bench in 2016.
ngos: Audubon Canyon Ranch (board); Peninsula Open Space Trust (board); San Francisco Opera (board); United Religions Initiative (President's Advisory Council)

name: Millar, Roger J.
title: Unknown
notes: Roger J. Millar appears on Bohemian Grove member lists in the Hill Billies camp. Insufficient public biographical information was found to identify his employer or professional background with confidence. He should not be confused with Roger M. Millar, the Washington State Secretary of Transportation.

name: Miller, J. Sanford
title: General Partner
notes: J. 'Sandy' Sanford Miller joined IVP in April 2006 and focuses on later-stage venture and growth equity investments in technology and digital media. He has over 35 years of venture capital and investment banking experience, has appeared nine times on the Forbes Midas List of top venture capitalists, and has been involved in over 100 IPOs and served on over 25 boards. He holds a BA from University of Virginia, and both an MBA and JD from Stanford.
ngos: University of Virginia Fralin/UVA Art Museum (board); Arts Council at UVA (former Chair)

name: Nicholson, W. John
title: Chief Operating Officer
notes: W. John Nicholson has served as Chief Operating Officer at Raetex Industries (a bitumen modification company for the road industry in the US and Middle East) since 2012. Prior to that he spent 25 years (1987-2012) in real estate development, financing, construction, and property management in Campbell, California. He holds an MBA from Claremont Graduate University (1980-1982).

name: Rawson, Ronald Craig
employer: R&R Ventures Development / CA Trade LLC
title: Managing Partner
notes: Ronald Craig Rawson is Managing Partner of R&R Ventures Development/CA Trade LLC with over 25 years of executive management and operations experience in manufacturing, payments, and venture development, and 10 years in international business and trade. He has held advisory roles in investor relations, biotech, communications, and military technology. He is also a real estate broker in Orinda, CA.

name: Richardson, Edward Thompson
title: Unknown
notes: Edward Thompson Richardson appears on Bohemian Grove member lists in the Hill Billies camp. Insufficient public biographical information was found to identify his employer or professional background.

name: Robertson, Channing Rex
title: Professor Emeritus of Chemical Engineering (Ruth G. and William K. Bowes Professor, Emeritus)
notes: Channing Rex Robertson joined the Stanford Chemical Engineering faculty in 1970 and retired in 2012. He served as department chair and Senior Associate Dean for Faculty & Academic Affairs. He became the first board member of Theranos (founded by his student Elizabeth Holmes) and was a witness at the criminal fraud trial that convicted Holmes. He has published over 160 peer-reviewed articles.

name: Sutherland, Kenneth H.
title: Unknown
notes: Kenneth H. Sutherland appears on Bohemian Grove member lists in the Hill Billies camp. Insufficient public biographical information was found to identify his employer or professional background with confidence.

name: Sutherland, William D.
title: Unknown
notes: William D. Sutherland appears on Bohemian Grove member lists in the Hill Billies camp. He appeared on the 2008 Bohemian Grove guest list. Insufficient public biographical information was found to identify his employer or professional background.

name: Vogt, Evon Z. III
title: Managing Director
notes: Evon Zartman 'Terry' Vogt III (born August 29, 1946, Chicago) is the son of Harvard anthropologist Evon Z. Vogt Jr. He earned an AB from Harvard (1968) and an MBA from University of Colorado (1976). Career highlights: USAID Peace Corps in Brazil (1968-1972); Wells Fargo Bank VP (1977-1986); President, ARBI Transnat. Inc., San Francisco (1986-2002); Deputy Director General, Inter-American Institute for Cooperation on Agriculture (2002-2004); Director, Gordon & Betty Moore Foundation (2004-2007); Managing Director, Terra Global Capital LLC (2008-present).
ngos: International Diplomacy Council (board director and former president, 1990-1998); Gordon & Betty Moore Foundation (former director)
